intro: Exomiocarpon, commonly known as the "golden thistle," is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Exomiocarpon is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments. Its botanical structure supports its role in both ecological and ornamental contexts.
